verbs.description: pretermit (third-person singular simple present pretermits, present participle pretermitting, simple past and past participle pretermitted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To intentionally disregard (something), to ignore; to neglect or omit. [from 15th c.]
examples: The liberty of a subject lieth, therefore, only in those things which, in regulating their actions, the sovereign hath praetermitted (such as is the liberty to buy, and sell, and otherwise contract with one another; to choose their own abode, their own diet, their own trade of life, and institute their children as they themselves think fit; and the like).
